text: The 1912 Philadelphia Phillies season was a season in American baseball. The team finished fifth in the National League with a record of 73–79, 30½ games behind the first-place New York Giants. == Regular season == === Season standings === === Record vs. opponents === === Notable transactions === * June 21, 1912: John Titus was traded by the Phillies to the Boston Braves for Doc Miller.Doc Miller page at Baseball-Reference * July 1912: Hank Ritter was purchased by the Phillies from the East Liverpool Potters.Hank Ritter page at Baseball-Reference === Roster === {| class="toccolours" style="font-size: 95%;" |- !
